page.title: 02St. Marys Church
page.content: came from an earlier church that was demolished and rebuilt. There is a{figure}of a{knight in {armour}in the chancel. It is thought to be Sir Samson Foliat who lived in the village in 1249. He might have had the church built. He has crossed legs and they are very bent which may mean that he fought and was wounded in the Crusades. The main part of the church, the {nave}was re-roofed in 1525 at the order of{Katherine of Aragon,}who owned land in Chilton Foliat. She wrote to William Darrel of Littlecote ordering him to deliver three oaks for the repair of the roof.This roof is still there and is described as a "waggon roof on carved wallposts". The{gallery}was built in 1694 and the villagers were asked to contribute to its erection.
